intro: Nissolia uncinata, commonly known as the hooked nissolia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hooked hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Nissolia uncinata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
